task_description:
# Interactive Onboarding Tour

Create a guided onboarding experience that walks new users through the platform's key features, explains the IDEA Framework methodology, and helps them understand the value they'll receive.

## Rationale
Competitors like StoryBrand are primarily educational courses - users expect guidance. An interactive tour differentiates from static tools and ensures users understand the full capability of the platform. Reduces support burden and improves activation rates.

## User Stories
- As a new user, I want a guided tour so that I understand how to use all the features
- As a user unfamiliar with brand strategy, I want the IDEA Framework explained so that I understand its value

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Tour launches for new users after account creation
- [ ] Highlights key features: Diagnostic, IDEA Framework, Avatar Builder, Brand Coach
- [ ] Explains the value of each feature
- [ ] Can be skipped or revisited
- [ ] Tracks completion for analytics
- [ ] Mobile-friendly implementation

patterns.hooks: Custom hooks use React Query for data fetching, return data/loading/error states, and use useServices for service layer access
patterns.services: Service layer with interfaces in src/services/interfaces/, Supabase implementations in src/services/
patterns.types: TypeScript types defined in src/types/ directory
patterns.context_providers: App.tsx uses Provider pattern (AuthProvider, BrandProvider) for global state
patterns.storage: Combined localStorage and Supabase persistence pattern (see useDiagnostic.ts)
patterns.components: Radix UI components in src/components/ui/, custom components in src/components/
patterns.styling: Tailwind CSS with Radix UI design tokens

existing_implementations.description: Found existing user profile system with Supabase integration and localStorage usage patterns
relevant_files: src/hooks/useAuth.tsx - Auth state and user session management
src/hooks/useProfile.ts - User profile data fetching and updates
src/hooks/useFeatureFlag.ts - localStorage usage pattern with sessionStorage
